cs0x65.parkinglot.impl

Interface Parkable<O,T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ParkingLot

    public interface Parkable<O,T>
    Represents an entity or resource that is able provide the parkable behaviour.
    A Parkable resource is the one which lets user park, un-park the objects - like cars, or for that matter any goods and query the current status of the resource.
    E.g. Parking lot, something like Warehouse can also be viewed a parkable resource. How about bank account? (park, un-park funds :) )
    Implemented by ParkingLot

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T leave(O object, long duration) 
      T park(O object) 
      String status(boolean includeEmptySlots) 

    • Method Detail

      • park

        T park(O object)
        Parameters:
        object - the object to be parked.
        Returns:
        the corresponding entity/record that captures the details of parking transaction. Implementing classes are free to define their semantics based on the parameterized types. For e.g. in case of ParkingLot, the object being parked is Car whereas the returned object is a Ticket instance.

      • leave

        T leave(O object,
        long duration)
        Parameters:
        object - the object to be un-parked/withdrawn from the parkable resource.
        duration - the duration for which the object was parked
        Returns:
        the corresponding entity/record that captures the details of un-parking transaction.

      • status

        String status(boolean includeEmptySlots)
        Parameters:
        includeEmptySlots - specifies whether the status information shall include empty slots.
        Returns:
        the status of the parkable resource. The implementing classes are free to return whatever is relevant to their domain and satisfy their semantics.
